report.ceiling_analysis: The student struggled during the Warm-up phase, particularly with providing information about hobbies and personal experiences.

domain_analyses.observation: The student provided very short responses and showed hesitation, particularly when asked to elaborate on personal experiences.
The student used simple sentence structures but struggled with more complex responses, leading to incomplete thoughts.
The vocabulary used was very basic and lacked specificity, with frequent use of generic terms.
Responses lacked logical flow and connection to the questions asked, indicating difficulty in maintaining a coherent discourse.

logic_errors_to_debug: Expand vocabulary related to personal interests and experiences.
Practice forming complete sentences to express thoughts.
report.optimization_strategy: Engage in Picture Narration exercises to describe images related to hobbies and daily activities.

verbal_summary:
Based on our conversation, I've assessed your Korean proficiency at A1 level. You performed well during the Warm-up phase. The student struggled during the Warm-up phase, particularly with providing information about hobbies and personal experiences. 
Let me break down the key areas: Your strongest area is fluency with a rating of 2 out of 5. The student provided very short responses and showed hesitation, particularly when asked to elaborate on personal experiences. An area to focus on is coherence, rated at 2 out of 5. Responses lacked logical flow and connection to the questions asked, indicating difficulty in maintaining a coherent discourse. 
I recommend starting with the A1 - Basic Communication Skills module. The top patterns to work on are: 1. Expand vocabulary related to personal interests and experiences. 2. Practice forming complete sentences to express thoughts. 
For practice, I suggest this exercise: Engage in Picture Narration exercises to describe images related to hobbies and daily activities. 
You're making good progress! Keep practicing regularly.
